content.description: Climb over mossy low-angled rock to the tree then continue up the more vertical flake. Belay from the next ledge then continue up a jam crack splitting the face to a belay in the wide chimney above.Traverse out a roof and into a right leaning dihedral and follow it to the top. Use a two 60m rope rappel from a tree to get down.
content.protection: Standard rack. Maybe a #4 for the chimney section.
content.location: 30 feet right of After the Fact. Locate a crack with a tree growing from it it about 15ft up.

content.description: The crack starts wide and then turns into an even wider flake toward the top. Once at the top, travers right to rappel down from a tree. Employ fist and offwidth crack technique
content.protection: Standard rack with a focus on larger (#2s and up)  pieces. Bring at least two #4s and maybe a #5 fore the top flake.
content.location: Far left side of the main wall. About 5 feet from an obvious corner.

content.description: Climb a crack to a triangular roof, then step right around the overhang and into a left-facing dihedral. Continue up the crack until you can travers right to some trees. Use the trees to rappel to the ground.
content.location: about 80 feet to the right of Private Duty Nurses, and is marked by an obvious triangular roof.

content.description: A wide chimney full of chockstones. Climb the chimney to a large ledge about 35ft up, and then continue up another 50 feet to a second ledge. Rappel off a tree at the top.
content.protection: Larger pieces and runners to sling the chockstones.
content.location: 25 feet right of Nickel Night. Obvious chimney.
